website_summaries.verdict: This rangefinder isn't for seasoned hunters, but it's worth considering for beginners.
pros: Lightweight build makes it easy to carry
Delivers crisp images and speedy scans
Low price makes it a great choice for novices and occasional users
Camo look appeals to outdoor and hunting enthusiasts
cons: Not the most accurate or durable model
Doesn't work well in low-light settings

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. Units that fail will not be supported by TecTecTec.
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked for a few months, then the LCD display started failing, with only half the digits showing. I thought it was battery related, so I put a new battery in but the issue persisted. I emailed TecTecTec support, and they asked me to put the rangefinder in the sun for a day. I tried that, but it didn’t work. I emailed support what to do next, but they stopped responding.
customer_reviews.author: Swan

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but read this if unit won't turn on
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace older bulky range finder that still works but had to fix wires and hard to change battery. The Prowild is compact, accurate, and I like the continuous ranging feature. One issue I had was when I installed the battery it worked great and once it timed out and turned off it wouldn't turn back on unless I took battery cap off and on again then it worked till it timed out and so on. I figured out the brass connection on the cap was tarnished enough to not make good contact to positive end of the battery. I carefully scraped the brass contact on the cap and now it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Craig E.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service. Company stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.text: Great rangefinder for the price. However, I ran into some issues with the unit, which the customer service at the company promptly took care of. Described issue, which included mode not cycling and company did not hesitate to offer new replacement unit in exchange for the old one. Very impressed. They wanted the old one so that they can investigate the cause and resolve the issue. This tells me the company not only stands behind their product, but endeavors to make it better.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin

customer_reviews.title: By far the best value!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Easy to use, compact, and comes with battery, lanyard, microfiber cloth, and protective pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the best range finder for the money. I opened it up and I was measuring distance in five minutes. it is clear and easy to operate with gloves on. I use it more than the big name brands that I have that cost twice as much. My Grandson play with sometimes when he shoots his bb gun and it has been dropped a couple of times and it still works great. You can't beat this for the money. The longest distance I have used this is 400 yds. and it is right on the money.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: was going to get him the Bushnell brand until I read the reviews then I seen this and how great reviews it had
customer_reviews.text: got this for my husband for Christmas, was going to get him the Bushnell brand until I read the reviews then I seen this and how great reviews it had. Works just the way it should and has a really clear view.
customer_reviews.author: Elaina Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: Great Rangefinder, Great Product, Great price!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rangefinder if you love hunting, and would really like a premium rangefinder the ProWild is perfect. I find the TecTecTec’s PROWILD Laser Rangefinder to be the very best so far. It provides a super accurate laser range measurement as much as 540 yds. It is lightweight, compact and ergonomic with water and mud resistant body. Comes with everything to get started, really easy to use. A fantastic buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This range finder is as advertised. I watched the little video prior to purchasing it so when it came it took me about 5 minutes to load the 3v included battery and get it going. I tested it with another laser rangefinder I had up to 15 yards and it was right on the money. As a retired land surveyor I understand the principle of no-visible laser distance measuring devices and for the money this little guy does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Henstridge

customer_reviews.title: Cant believe they have decent reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in this item. I used it on my first hunt and the yards wont even show up... only meters... the yards just go blank. And also its so fuzzy i can barely see it in good light much less low light. I read reviews and thought man these seem pretty good. But found out they were really cheap made. Really disappointed in the product. Hate to put bad reviews anywhere but felt i needed to warn others to buy other places.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart hall

customer_reviews.title: %100 satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This range finder is really nice, just like any of these I take a few measurements to get a more accurate reading. Most of the time it's within 1 yard/meeter of measurement. This also depends on the type of surface you measurements on. From what I've seen with other range finders, this one takes very good measurements. Clear glass easy to use, basically a standard set up on it. I haven't put it through abuse yet or have gotten to see how long the battery lasts but I will come back and update later.
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Horrible with moisture
customer_reviews.text: I dont normally write Amazon reviews but I had to for this. I would not bother with this range finder. I bought it this year for hunting and it worked well for archery (sub 60 yds). However once rifle season came around..I found that it would take over 10 tries to range my full sized SUV at 300 yards when out shooting, I could hardly believe it. Also, I dropped it in the snow on my last hunt, brushed it off, and every lense fogged up rendering the range finder USELESS outside of 50 yd. Just from dropping it in the snow! Do not buy this cheapo range finder!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made/Poor Warranty
customer_reviews.text: 2 months after purchasing rangefinder I happened to drop it while climbing a tree stand. I picked it back up to find that the outer lense peice had popped off. I contacted customer service, but the only "support" I received was advice from them to just glue it back on. Not pleased at all. Will not be purchasing another tectectec product again. Recommend anybody reading this to spend the extra money and get something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: jon lee

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: After hunting with it for two seasons I feel like I can comfortably say this has been a good range finder. Easy to use. Battery life has be very good. It’s also pretty accurate on the range it displays. For the price, I don’t think you’ll find a better one. The plastic doesn’t feel super durable, but I keep this in my pack until I’m in the stand. I have dropped my pack from a 10+ feet high a few times from my stands by accident and it hasn’t effected the range finder, so it seems to be reasonably durable. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Noah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent affordable rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder is an excellent and affordable rangefinder. I use mine for ranging established points in the vicinity of my hunting blind so if game comes in when they are near the places I have already pre-ranged then I know the range of the game without having to do additional movements to range the animal itself. I also use this rangefinder when setting up my targets for practice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read great reviews on the Prowild TecTecTec range finder and purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: Read great reviews on the Prowild TecTecTec range finder and purchased one at a good price. I am a bow hunter and golfer and can say this is a great range finder for both sporting events. It's easy to operate thru the functions, really light weight, small and handy. It's hard to keep it steady to one point (my shaking error) but the continuous range display while scanning compensates for it. I have shot ranges out to 476 yards. Great product and serves my purposes well. The two day shipping was great and ordered it Friday night and got it Sunday morning. Thanks TecTecTec.
customer_reviews.author: Kui

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart on my first hunting trip with it--on an important stalk, of course.
customer_reviews.text: Ranging was okay, though it needed a really dark solid background to get a reading. Seemed to do okay out to stated yardage range. Quality, though, was terrible. the battery cap was held in by a tiny plastic nub that snapped when I tried to remove the cap. This happened on a stalk, of course, the very first time I had it in the field. Will attempt to get a refund. Updated: They replaced the broken unit, but would not provide a refund. Service was fast and courteous. But now I have a new low-quality rangefinder. Will likely be shopping for a higher-quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive solution
customer_reviews.text: I took the rangefinder out of the box, inserted the batteries and used it the first day to check its accuracy, it was great! It was easy to operate and stored away in my backpack without a problem. It has a clear field of view and was accurate within at least an inch at 600 yards. I was impressed with its construction and design features. I'm planning on upgrading to a more advanced model soon. It 's a good rangefinder for a hunter and first time user, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: CMR

customer_reviews.title: Totally inaccurate. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Totally inaccurate. I tested it with multiple stationary objects (trees, rocks, etc.) and the measurement in yards was wayyyy off. It told me a tree was 14 yards away that was only about ten feet away. I tried it on a rock that was about 20 feet away and it read 28 yards. This thing doesn’t seem to know the difference between feet and yards.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Buy the S model with Angle Compensation
customer_reviews.text: TTT shouldn't even be selling the base model with camo and marketing to hunters because last I checked the only people who care about yardage are archers. Gun hunters zero at 50y and call it a day because at 100y they're still within an inch most of the time. Bow hunters MUST have true horizontal distance to account for arrow drop. If the finder measures straight distance as the base model does...you will miss high badly if you're in a tree 15 feet above the target. Buy the S model. they should stop selling this stupid base model.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Clear, Fast and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have been shopping for a hunting rangefinder for awhile now and was thoroughly confused by the vast array of choices in the $100-$150 range. The ProWild Hunting rangefinder is in my opinion, the perfect choice. Operation can't be simpler, the 6x magnification view is crystal clear, and the yardage readings are virtually instantaneous. Match all that with a 30 second auto-shutoff and this is a great piece of kit for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Vince E.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: For its first use I took it for a 2 hr hike. Had it in my front shirt pocket and by the time I got back to the truck moisture had condensed inside the viewing appature. Called tech support and they said to leave it in the sun on my dash for 4 days...it didnt solve what shouldnt have been an issue in the first place. Unit is very light weight and feels like it would break just from being handled too hard. Dont waste the money, buy a Bushnell or Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dumford

customer_reviews.title: And recommend it to a friend
customer_reviews.text: I haven't out in the woods for a full day yet. But I received exactly what I expected. I barely read the instructions, just went outside and worked it out in about 5 minutes. I archery hunt from a climbing stand in many different spots, and this is my first range finder. From testing in my back yard, it worked to perfection. It read yardage instantly. I would buy this brand again. And recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I gave it one star because I can't give it zero stars. The device is highly inaccurate. I measured a fixed point at 280 yards and the first measure came out to be 275 yards and the second measure came to 245 yards. Cheap and worthless device.
customer_reviews.author: Raz

customer_reviews.title: Quick, handy, and accurate!
customer_reviews.text: The TecTecTec ProWild Hunting Rangefinder has performed very well so far, at least as far as the range-finding function. It provides accurate readouts very quickly. Also, it is lightweight and very easy to take along for whatever my ranging needs are. It has really tightened up my hunting and shooting activities by providing accurate ranges. I have yet to try the speed measurement function.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Got this for deer season. Hunting in the hills of TN I was having trouble judging the distance. Ordered this and got a very nice buck as a result, now - not that you care about my buck, I’ll discuss the range finder. It’s light and very accurate up to 300 yards. Might be better further, but I haven’t tested it. It finds the item you are finding quickly (like my buck, just saying). One thing, carry another battery with you, at least for the battery that comes with it was drained very fast. You can get a replacement battery at wal mart or here on good ole amazon, it has lasted all season. Hey, did I mention the buck?
customer_reviews.author: Chilli

customer_reviews.title: Nice rangefinder for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this. I had used Google Earth pro to range out a few points for testing scopes. I paced them out also, and came up with the same distance. When I got my range finder, I shot them and got the exact readings that I had gotten in the other two methods. I ranged out to 200 yards with good accuracy. I am VERY happy with these. They will definitely help in work and at the range.
customer_reviews.author: CKJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for the elk muzzle loader but I really wish I would have gotten one with a greater range for rifle hunts/shooting. The quality seemed good and it was accurate up to the 200-240 yard range. It is incredibly simple to figure out and use. Overall I was very happy with it and it is perfect for bow, muzzle loader, and short range shooting.
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat works for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for bowhunting. It is on the cheaper side compared to most rangefinders, I guess that's for a good reason. When I range something out from the same spot every time you press the range button it reads a different range sometimes varying by more then 7 yards, which for some just isn't accurate enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price. Accurate with a yard or two.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this rangefinder is great. I went to the football field to test the accuracy. Within the 100 yards it is spot on give or take a yard or two. When we went farther apart the numbers would jump around but after a couple of reads I would get consistent number at 193 yards. I have no need for the speed function so did not test it. I would buy this again for the price and for what I use it for. I am using this for hunting.
customer_reviews.author: christina gifford

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this a couple of times for target check distance for target shooting seems accurate haven't any problems so far. I usually never ive a product a full five stars until I have used it for more than a year.I don't like the case it came with been looking for a different case. The one that comes with unit will not stay closed keeps popping open.But everything else seems to work great !
customer_reviews.author: patricia L. Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Not working for longer ranges
customer_reviews.text: This feels kinda flimsy but not horrible. It is a decent pattern and I have not tested accuracy to a finite number but with ranges I know it is close enough for my comfort. The biggest downside is it does not work to advertised range. I cant get anything in the 400s or 500s to show. This is really only useful up to 400 yards I would say. Maybe my unit is defective i dont know.
customer_reviews.author: I. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: ... around the house and at work but its very nice and quick to read yards
customer_reviews.text: I have just tried it around the house and at work but its very nice and quick to read yards. I am going to use it for coyote hunting, I cant judge distance at all and after my co worker seen my Tec Tec Tec work they cant either, so I might have sold you some more of them ? All in all a great product !!! That You " Outlaw Jack Coyote Hunter "
customer_reviews.author: jack price

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Only used once so far down my street at a car....worked like promised...ease if use and function get 5 stars Finally got to use it in the wild...pre scouting for a hunt coming up in a couple of weeks...was not able to get 90% of the ranges that I shot for. Yes I shot for large objects not tree etc. Unfortunately i am out if the return window otherwise would send back. I will try on the golf course I guess. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Mark

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but useless in low light
customer_reviews.text: Readout isn't backlit which made this useless for me since I need it in low light morning and evening hunts. Works great in full sunlight unless you are looking at a dark object. Had to return it. 3-stars since it is marketed to hunters but isn't very useful without a backlight but was accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and easy to use. The battery can get bumped and cause it not to power up. I stretched the spring and have no issues now. That is the only reason for not giving 5 stars. It comes with a nice case and lanyard. Im they would have replaced it but it wasn't a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: I am using it to sight in rifles. A quick Google search will get you the answer but the only issue I had was nowhere in the directions does it tell you how to switch between meters and yards. I would have gone 5 stars otherwise. I've only used it out to 100 yards so far but it works as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Marc H

customer_reviews.title: Decent range finder for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a relatively inexpensive range finder compared to the more expensive options out there this may be the one for you. Simple to use. I don't necessary need the speed option, but being able to use the range mode and continuously range different distances by holding the range button down is a nice feature. Case is ok, but would have liked something a little more rigid with other attachment options other than the belt loop. Having said that if this sounds like something you are interested in I would check it out. 2 yr warranty gives you a piece of mind as well. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: china junk
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy, gives multiple readings when standing in the same spot. went fron 32 yds. down to 26 yds. without moving. Might work better at long distance . Not good for archery.
customer_reviews.author: mso

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy for ground hog yardages.
customer_reviews.text: So far-so good. It serves its purpose and is very user friendly. When hunting groundhogs, those little bidders can easily be out 200-300 yards. It’s nice to know the yardage so you can compensate for bullet drop. Very small and lightweight. The batteries haven’t run out yet and the timer/turn off feature is genius.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Nice range finder
customer_reviews.text: This is my first range finder so I really don't have anything to compare it to. I use it to train retrieving dogs in the field. I have only used it with still objects that are not moving. I like it, but you really have to make sure what you're pointing at is in focus or it will not measure the distance accurately. The range seems to jump around a little in the finder. Having said that, it really seems to do a good job especially for the price. I obviously could have paid more to have an automatic focus, but I'm glad I made the decision it did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ProWild gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rangefinder to use archery hunting and it fulfills my needs, it is easy to use, lightweight and small. The black text is sometimes difficult to read with low lighting and dark terrain, but I've gotten every distance when needed. All in all, this product is perfect for my first rangefinder.
customer_reviews.author: MattM

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder is easy to use and accurate. We compared the accuracy against two other rangefinders and this one is spot on. Its a little difficult to use right out of the box but once you get the hang of it, it’s simple. The batteries do die somewhat quickly so keep a spare set around.
customer_reviews.author: Mere Mac

customer_reviews.title: Default mode is metric
customer_reviews.text: I don’t care for tiny unusable manuals that don’t include all the useful information that a user needs. For instance how do I get it to switch from metric!! Ok figured that out. Had to hold the mode button in for a second. That might have been something to include in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: stgecko

customer_reviews.title: 100% satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is my first year to archery hunt. An affordable, accurate and reliable rangefinder was absolutely necessary and I found just that in this rangefinder. I wear it on my hip for easy and quick access for when the need arises. The case has performed flawlessly as well. I constantly check it to make sure the unit is in place and it was always stayed closed until I open it. I don't think you can go wrong with it. I've even left it in my truck over night with temps in the teens with no adverse effects I've been using this for about 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased the rangefinder and it would not record yardage, just meters. After contacting the manufacturer, they were incredibly helpful in providing an exchange. Service was fast and very efficient. Thanks to Isabella at TecTecTec! She is the BEST! I have now been using the replacement rangefinder and it is fantastic. I have been hunting and buying products for hunting for over 40 years and this has been one of the best purchases I have made. It works great, clear picture, accurate readings, and now I am spoiled-can't be without it when I am out in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: angela adams

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first rangefinder and I like it. The brand name is a bit ridiculous and I feel good for saying it. But if that is the only complaint then that's saying something. The lens is adjustable and the lens reading is clear. I really like the design too and it feels solid in my hand. I also like the extra accessories it came with. For $100 this was a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended on a budget
customer_reviews.text: For the price and features it can not be beat. Highly recommended on a budget. This will do for most except the very demanding like a sniper lol. Nice finish. The only thing I can not comment on is durability since I had it only a couple of months. So take that into account.So far no problems,
customer_reviews.author: Cronus

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good range finder
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good range finder, first I’ve purchased! I was able to get yardage reading from 148 yards with a shaky hand pointed at a medium size tree. I assume you put the square on the target, directions didn’t state that! Happy so far plus have a extra 1 year warrant for free! I can only assume the readings are correct? Don’t know how to test the accuracy... don’t look at small yardage, like inside garage, or you will get a headache! Clarity and magnitude are pretty good! I would recommend this product, haven’t tried the speed thing yet. This happy so far
customer_reviews.author: Steve sumner

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: It really is easy to use, surprisingly light weight and is very accurate. We did use it hunting a couple of weeks ago. I ranged out the deer for my son at 220 yards across a ravine and one shot it was down. After getting to the deer, used the range finder the other way to where he shot and again 220 yards.
customer_reviews.author: R-Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: great range finder
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rangefinder. Use many others from Friends. Could not answer your question on why I chose tec tec tec, but my wallet is glad I did. It's worth twice as much, but please don't tell tec tec tec. very easy to use, clear numbers and of course accuracy...
customer_reviews.author: Regular Customer

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP AF!
customer_reviews.text: This range finder didn't work from receiving it right out of the box. It feels super cheap and not solid at all. I was crazy disappointed and had to send it back. Also not very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far works great. Out of the box it was set to meters. After figuring out how to change it to yards it was good to go. I figured the default would of been yards it would of made it ready to go out of the box. I’ll report back after 6 months on how it’s doing.
customer_reviews.author: Park Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Hunting buddy approved
customer_reviews.text: As a rangefinder it works just as good as my hunting buddies high dollar one. And believe me he tried to bash mine because of the price. You know how hunting buddies are. I have not used the speed function yet but it works great for distance in feet and yards. Cant beat the price either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate and inconsistent, terrible for a bow hunter
customer_reviews.text: This range finder is not a good choice for a bow hunter. It is way off when comparing to other range finders my friends have and it takes many tries to get a reading on trees when using in the woods. I couldn't even get it to range find on my truck. Total waste of money. What's the point of an inaccurate range finder?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Was not expecting much at this price point, however I am more than happy with my purchase. I wanted a secondary Range Finder to keep in my go to bag, so I wasn't looking to spend hundreds of dollars. To my surprise in a side by side test against my more expensive Range Finder, this little guy was much more accurate. If your not a professional sniper, than this unit should satisfy most needs for target or hunting. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Black

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first range finder so I can't compare to others, but, I haven't had any issues with accuracy, even up close. A few reviews show this a problem under 50yds but mine is pretty accurate at 10yds and up. Pleasantly surprised. A very nice range finder especially for the price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Stalcup

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. JUNK.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an elk hunt. DO NOT buy this product it doesn't perform. Did not range past 20 urds in the field without any obstruction. You get what you pay for. In this case it's junk.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, well constructed quality product
customer_reviews.text: Well made. It does exactly what the advertisement says. Great value. I checked its accuracy on my archery range and it performed exactly on a 50 and 30 yard test. I'm very pleased with my purchase, Time will determine its durability.
customer_reviews.author: DC101

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: Yards are off. Not clear and you have to adjust sight which is not efficient. But when you adjust you cant see the numbers or adjust so you can see the numbers but then image goes blurry. Would not recommend for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: economic and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I needed a range finder for my cabin. Lots of wild pig there, but neighbors were well within gun shot range. Bought crossbow but needed accurate range to the target for my scope. Tectectec Prowild filled the bill nicely. Very accurate and easy to use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bear

customer_reviews.title: Well made and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit for my upcoming elk hunt. As I always do, I checked out a number of different rangefinders and the associated reviews before pulling the trigger on this one. Prior to the hunt I had a chance to try it out on the golf course. So far very impressed and just what I was looking for. Seems to be very well built, with a nice compact size and some water resistance. Nice carrying case as well. Accuracy and ease of use have been spot on. I would definitely recommend this TecTecTec rangefinder. Looking forward to using it on some hunts this fall.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M Olson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but can be hard to see.
customer_reviews.text: What I liked: it is compact, has its own holster with belt loop, and it is very easy to use. The only thing I don't like is that it is hard to see the digital display and cross hairs in low light or on a dark background. This is fairly important because hunting often starts in the early morning or in the late afternoon when lighting is darker.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It’s accurate and also gives you pretty good magnification in addition to the range finding capabilities. So much so that I now use it in place of my monocular. It’s not a replacement for your scope or binoculars but it’s good for glassing & quick scanning.
customer_reviews.author: TONYG868

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I have owned my Tec Tec Tec for 3 years and it has slowly quit working altogether. As soon as I got it I notice how slow it was to get a reading. A lot harder than the other 2 brands I owned previously. If the sun was out forget about it, I got no reading. I can honestly say 20.00 more will buy a name brand rangefinder........Marc
customer_reviews.author: d r

customer_reviews.title: Pixels burned out
customer_reviews.text: Have used it 8-10 times over the last year. Went to use it recently and found some of the pixels are burned out of the distance display. Very difficult to read now, have to guestimate readings now......
customer_reviews.author: Looch1

customer_reviews.title: Good but missing wrist strap
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas.. he loves it but it was supposed to come with a wrist strap and it did not have one enclosed. Wishes he did have it to help him use. Other than that seems like a good product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Dina Trizzino

customer_reviews.title: Fired right up
customer_reviews.text: It's light and accurate. With all of the gear (gotta have water and lunch) in my back pack for an all day hunting trip, it is really important to have something light when your stand is a half mile walk and accurate . When facing an open field, ranging for distance is VERY important especially when that 10 point buck is coming across the field broad side. This range finder will put you on the mark every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great compact product that is accurate and has a great price.
customer_reviews.text: It's the first time I have used a product like this. All I can say is WOW it made my hunting season much more enjoyable not wondering what my yardage was. I.foundnit extremely accurate and easy to use. My teenage son was also able to pick it up and use it with little instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: With many options and such a variation in price I chose the prowild as sort of middle of the road. This is my first range finder and I am quite pleased with it. Very clear instructions and easy to use and the clarity is spot on. Happy camper here!
customer_reviews.author: ADKROCK

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this over a year ago. Its not your named brand rangefinder, but the price was right. After numerous times out in the field, I am very happy with this Rangefinder. It's very crisp and clear point of view.
customer_reviews.author: Pete S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this range finger! I have never vhsd one before and was needing one in order to site in my bow! After just taking 5 minutes to look over the owners manual I was hitting the bullseye with my bow in the matter of minutes! Right price and gray product! I would recommend this to anyone! I would weather but this one than an expensive one because I am sure that it does just as good of a job as the high end ones!
customer_reviews.author: Nehuskerfanatic

customer_reviews.title: Lost Battery Cover
customer_reviews.text: First off the range finder works amazing well for the cost. I have taken it on a couple hunts, and had no issues with ranging what i want to range. I would like to add the customer service is awesome. i at some point lost my battery cover for my range finder and asked them if there was a way to buy a replacement, they offered just to replace it for me!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't pick up anything past 300 yds, it also says 300yds is 400 yds
customer_reviews.author: Juggernaut Weldfab

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband to use during hunting trips. He uses it for everything dealing with distance. No issues with it. The range finder functions well and is easy to use. It is compact and light weight. Definitely a positive buying experience.
customer_reviews.author: T Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for intro users
customer_reviews.text: Limited range of yardage but this is a low budget range finder. I am thoroughly pleased with it's performance for the price. Definitely a high quality low budget range finder.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon White

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. The unit is much smaller than I thought ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. The unit is much smaller than I thought it would be. That is a good thing. It will drop into almost any pocket. The controls are intuitive even for an old man. The 6 power is enough for me to use it instead of binoculars. The focus adjustment works with my glasses with no problem. Good price. Good product
customer_reviews.author: Samuel  W. Pullig

customer_reviews.title: Hope it keeps working.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered first one it was lost in transit for a week. Amazon credited and I reordered another. Both showed up the following day. I opened box and tried first one it would not power on. Opened second box and that one worked great. Sent back the one that didn't work. Not had a chance to use in the field yet. Around the house it works fine. Time will tell. I am a little concerned that the first one didn't work. I checked the battery it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Battery wire broke while trying to replace battery. Battery is now stuck in the slot. Apparently thats not covered by the company. Get a Vortex.
customer_reviews.author: Jen H

customer_reviews.title: They're getting better
customer_reviews.text: I liked this pro wild rangefinder only thing that could use improving is it's hard to see in low light if it could have the Radicals and that information displayed lighting either red or a color that could display better on the screen instead of black it would be even better then it is now
customer_reviews.author: Army FA

customer_reviews.title: Tec Tec Tec Prowild Rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: This Rangefinder works excellent it is very accurate and dead on. It has three functions which is very good and it will range from 10 yards and less to its maximum of 540 yards I was impressed I highly suggest this Rangefinder and for the price it is very much worth it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very clear optics
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and easy to use.Fits firmly in my hand.It's got 450yards of range and that's more than enough for where I hunt.I'm very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: cuz1949

customer_reviews.title: Works so well!
customer_reviews.text: It's compact so very easy to carry. Easy to use and so accurate! It is exactly what I was looking for. And a good price from what I saw of the other ones as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and accurate
customer_reviews.text: What extra gizmos do you even need in a range finder. It does the job and does it well.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget RangeFinder
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it extensively for hunting, however, testing has shown great promise. The image and reticle are very clear and crisp in daylight and even some low/unfavorable light. But is non-existent in night time or very low light. Construction is very well built and the paint seems very durable and long lasting. The rangefinder also came with a battery, some small decals, a case, and an instruction manual as well as instructions to register your product for their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: semamian55

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely impressed with this product. I have used this Rangefinder in the Pacific Northwest rain, sleet, hail, snow, sun and heat and it has functioned quite well. The distances are quite accurate and the versatility of this product is impressive. I love being able to radio my hunting partner and tell him how far off he is from the decoy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W.

customer_reviews.title: Compact, light weight and easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, easy to use product for the price point. I only wish the display would light up instead of black. I like to check my distance points asap in the predawn light and the black numbers yield zero contrast.
customer_reviews.author: Jason E. Bulger Sr.

customer_reviews.title: It's not top of the line but it worked perfect for hunting both in CO mountains and in ND ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not top of the line but it worked perfect for hunting both in CO mountains and in ND prairie.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product. It is made very well and really ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. It is made very well and really easy to use. You can measure in yards and meters. View is crystal clear and very accurate. Cross hairs are easy to pinpoint your target. I have not used the speed measure function yet. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Crossbow Stawker

customer_reviews.title: competes with the top name brand optics
customer_reviews.text: This unit beat my expectations. The optic quality is great. The exterior is rugged and the case is well made for added protection. I used it to sight in my TC 50 Cal, At 100 and 150 yards. The accuracy was dead on and matched a Nicon at 1/3 the cost.. If I could change anything i would drop the speed calculator and spend the money on a 3-5 second delay to the digital readout after the completion of ranging a target. Thus the 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: steve mcintire

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and accurate. Measures the distance within seconds. No need to spend more and get an expensive one. This will give you what you need %100.
customer_reviews.author: bahar

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel, but I just got back from a archery hunt and used this, ranged the trees around me and noticed that it gives me a different number on the same tree everytime. Also, product comes with a dead battery. I think something may be wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: brockbrock8589

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Can be hard to keep it still long enough to get a perfect read on a small target, but if you do, it gives you a consistent measurement. I use it playing disc golf, and baskets are terrible targets for a device like this, but I'll have a buddy stand alongside it and just target him and that's plenty good enough for an accurate read.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J. Schaff

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bow hunter and range finders are necessary to scope yardage in a stand. Got this before my hunt last weekend and it worked as advertised. Scoped ranges, was consistent in it's readings, and worked as a temporary pair of nocs when looking at the surrounding area. For the price, you can't beat it. That said, I've used it for a grand total of two weekends. So unable to speak to its resiliency over time. Perfect so far for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a quality rangefinder for deer hunting, but did not want to pay a lot. I decided to try the ProWild as the specs and reviews were good. I am very pleased with the quality and function. It has clear optics and is very easy to use. I tested it at known distances and it was exact every time. I would buy it again and recommend to all.
customer_reviews.author: Bob from Nashville

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and read. Also, it's accurate. I used a tape measure to make my bow range (20, 25, 30, 35, & 40 yds) and this agrees. I don't foresee any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan R.

customer_reviews.title: amended
customer_reviews.text: I had written a terrible review on this product, had a terrible experience with the manufacturer, in the long run this company ( TEC TEC TEC ) made good on my purchase, Its was nice to see a young company do the right thing for their customer. Big thumbs up. My Prowild did not work correctly out of the box, hopefully my replacement works as advertised, this unit is light weight and fits well in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Wrona

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Gives accurate distances as best I can tell. Easy to use if you load the battery correctly. Optics are nice and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald LaPorta

customer_reviews.title: Works great when it works.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was so awesome at first. Second day I used it, it wouldn't work until I slapped it. Now I have to slap it every time. I have replaced the batteries and nothing. I would recommend spending more money. The last rangefinder worked for years until I just wore it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Newman

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Works ok so far, struggled to get reading at 500 yards in broad daylight, tried playing with it at night but if you look at something and the area below is dark, with the letters being black on screen I could not see the distance, so far good bang for the buck since I was trying to dial in a rifle scope between 100, 200 & 300 yards
customer_reviews.author: Gixxxer

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder is extremely easy to use and is very accurate. After using it during the entire 2018 season I had an issue that caused me to contact their Customer Support. I spoke to Isabella and she was fantastic. She responded to my messages promptly, she displayed a genuine desire to solve my problem, and she bent over backwards to make sure I was satisfied. Outstanding experience.
customer_reviews.author: Mgrimm

product_meta.title: TecTecTec ProWild Hunting Rangefinder - Laser Range Finder for Hunting with Speed, Scan and Normal Measurements
feature_bullets: HUNTING LASER RANGEFINDER; Tired of cheap rangefinders with short ranges of measurement? Our PROWILD Laser Rangefinder is a premium product, measuring up to 540 yards with continuous scan mode, advanced speed technology, and a durable, water resistant body!
SPEED, SCAN and HUNT TECHNOLOGY; Provides fast measurement with +/- 1 yard accuracy.

THROUGH THE LENS DISPLAY; Premium, ultra clear, multilayered optics with easy read, through the lens display with distance and battery meter, and continuous measurement mode for fast, convenient measurements!

LIGHTWEIGHT AND PORTABLE; (Eye-safe rangefinder Class 1 laser with <0.5mW average power output) measures just 104 x 72 x 41 mm and weighing just 185g, with a water and dust resistant, durable body, perfect for carrying while hunting, or for measuring and surveying without extra weight or bulk.

FULL PACKAGE; Complete rangefinder package for quick setup, including carrying pouch, CR2 battery, strap, microfiber cleaning cloth, quick start guide, TecTecTec Happy Guarantee for 2 Years (Online Registration Required) and Lifetime customer support.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
